# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can use the `Dates.format` function to extract the year and month from the DateTime column and concatenate them using string interpolation. Here's an example implementation of the `add_yearmonth` function:
```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[!, :ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM")
end
```

This assumes that the input DataFrame has a column named `dt` containing DateTime values. The output will be a new column named `ym` in the same DataFrame, containing strings in the format "yyyymm".
